definition: to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: Can I deposit my money through the ATM?
sentences.chinese: 我可以通過自動櫃員機存錢嗎？

sentences.english: Lotteries are being billed as a way to get wealth without saving and investing.
sentences.chinese: 彩票被描繪成不用投資和存錢就可以發財的捷徑。

sentences.english: Now you know the reason why saving box made as piggy bank.
sentences.chinese: 現在你知道爲什麼要用小豬做存錢罐了吧。

sentences.english: Teaching kids how to budget and save is key, Marshall says.
sentences.chinese: 馬歇爾認爲，問題的關鍵是應教孩子如何花錢和存錢。

sentences.english: Melinda Gates says saving by itself isn't enough.
sentences.chinese: 梅琳達基金會說，存錢靠本身是不夠的。

sentences.english: Even though Edith lives at the poverty level, she puts money into a savings account every month.
sentences.chinese: 儘管伊迪絲生活貧困，她仍然每月存錢。

sentences.english: See, if I paid fewer taxes, Id save money.
sentences.chinese: 那麼，如要我交的稅少，我就會存錢。

sentences.english: While you're saving up, I'm considering a name change.
sentences.chinese: 存錢的時候，我想名字也要變一變了。

sentences.english: Companies have been socking cash away for a rainy day since the financial crisis.
sentences.chinese: 發生金融危機以來，美國企業一直在未雨綢繆地存錢。

sentences.english: Daddy, Mummy, please buy a piggie for yourselves.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸媽媽，你們也買了錢罐存錢吧。

sentences.english: I will save up money to buy a iPad2.
You stay in your car and can make deposits or withdraws.
sentences.chinese: 你不需下車就能存錢或領錢。

sentences.english: He's even stashing away savings for his eventual return.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至還在爲他以後回國存錢。

sentences.english: The importance of saving money when young cannot overstressed.
sentences.chinese: 在年輕時存錢的重要性怎麼強調都不過分。

sentences.english: Believe me, no one ever regrets saving money for emergencies.
sentences.chinese: 相信我吧，沒人會爲緊急狀況存錢而後悔的。

sentences.english: Young adults should make it a priority to develop a regular saving plan.
sentences.chinese: 年輕人應該將有規律的存錢計劃作爲優先選擇項。

definition: to go abroad/to leave the country/emigration
preparation/to prepare/to intend/to be about to/reserve (fund)
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to return to one's home country
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
to read a book/to study/to attend school
